events.name: ArtScience on Screen: The Tale of the Princess Kaguya
events.description:
ArtScience on Screen: Anime Season – The Tale of the Princess Kaguya 

The Tale of the Princess Kaguya is based on one of Japan’s oldest folklore, The Tale of the Bamboo Cutter.  It tells the story of a mysterious girl who was discovered as a tiny nymph inside the stalk of a bamboo plant.  

The Tale of the Bamboo Cutter is featured in our exhibition, The Universe and Art. Dating back to the mid-10th century, the hand scroll is considered to be one of Japan’s oldest story about space. 

As part of Anime Season, ArtScience on Screen presents this extraordinary, award-winning animated classic from iconic animation company, Studio Ghibli. Enjoy this masterpiece of astounding visual beauty and imagination from the unrivalled dream factory running this July.

Dates and Screening Times: 
3 July - 11 July,13 July - 14 July, 16 July 
11.50AM, 2.10PM and 4.30PM
Rating: PG
Running time: 2 hours 20 minutes
Screening in English with no subtitles 

Venue: Expression Gallery, Level 4
Free Admission

#ArtScienceonScreen

events.name: Social Coding
events.description: A space for women coders to learn from each other, to practice and discuss learnings with fellow peers. This would be a weekly event of informal space to do coding. So bring your pet projects along or join one of our existing teams/ projects to work on. Featured Projects:https://trello.com/b/kl2BTwil/wwc-sg-social-coding-projects First timers, please read:Newbies Step-by-step Guide Please bring your own laptop. Agenda:6:30p - Registration and Introduce projects7:00p - Break out into groups and Start coding! ^_^8:30p - End session There is no food provided, so please make preparations to grab a bite before you turn up. Also, we recommend to bring your own water bottle along. Psst, this event is intended for ladies only. Host:
events.location: #03-04, IDA Labs@NDC 111 Middle Road, National Design Centre, Singapore 188969., IDA Labs@NDC 111 Middle Road, National Design Centre

events.name: Papers We Love #028
events.description:
Paper #1: Lazy Functional State Threads - John Launchbury and Simon L Peyton Jones :  http://homepages.dcc.ufmg.br/~camarao/fp/articles/lazy-state.pdf - Vaibhav Sagar

Paper #2: META II: A Syntax-Oriented Compiler Writing Language - http://www.chilton-computing.org.uk/acl/literature/reports/p025.htm - Melvin Zhang

-------------------

What was the last paper within the realm of computing/technology you read and loved?

What did it inspire you to build or tinker with? 

Come share the ideas in an awesome academic/research paper with fellow engineers, programmers, and paper-readers.
events.location: HackerspaceSG, 344B King George's Avenue, King George's Building, Singapore 208576
